name: Investment Processing Platform-Classic
description: - Human workflow and investment process support - Formalized expert knowledge - Work item traceability and live cycle monitoring - IDV risk reduction - Workload balancing across departments and locations using dematerialized work items - Scope (preliminary): Corporate Actions notification and instruction improvement

name: Investment Processing Platform-dbIPP
description: - Human workflow and investment process support - Formalized expert knowledge - Work item traceability and live cycle monitoring - IDV risk reduction - Workload balancing across departments and locations using dematerialized work items - Scope (preliminary): Corporate Actions notification and instruction improvement. This instance will support the Event Services - Corporate Actions (ES CA) department to prepare corporate action announcements with a modern, future-proof platform. It will retrieve the required data from several external sources like custodians, stock exchange or Wertpapier-Mitteilungen. The application will create Corporate Action events which become processed by ES CA department. Where applicable the application will also deliver CA announcement data to ee2 for the processing of CA transactions. It is intended that the application will serve as a Workflow Management Tool for the ES CA department and will replace the currently used CA Workflowmanager (CA WFM).

name: STEER
description: STEER (STeering with Empiricism, Experience & common Rules), focuses on the anticipatory & comprehensive planning & control of quantity-based capacity requirements and employee availabilities,as well as the introduction of productivity KPIs. The main objectives are to create comprehensive transparency and to improve the forecasting capabilities for all GSO units.STEER is a planning aid for managers, it provides support in the distribution of workloads to the available employees, while helping to make planning and prioritisation decisions more transparent and universal. In STEER, corporate control KPIs, such as productivity and productive time, are calculated for all activities to do with securities processing in GSO. STEER is a KPI-based system for production control and is not intended to monitor the behaviour or individual performance of employees. Data is collected and processed only on org unit level, at no time data can be traced back or associated to an individual employee level.

name: Euroclear Fundsettle-SG GSO
description:
Third party mandated application owned and managed by Euroclear with limited DB governance including NAR light registration. 
Fundsettle is the Euroclear platform that supports order routing, settlement and asset servicing solutions.
The access rights on the application is managed by Vendor Management Team in DBS Geneva.FundSettle ? a single access point for automated fund transaction processing and servicing, which includes automated cross-border dealing, settlement, asset servicing and reconciliation for mutual funds, money market funds and hedge funds. FundSettle is primarily used for the following purposes: 1. send subscription, redemption and switch orders to FundSettle. 2. receive the related order status and confirmation reporting. 3. access consolidated reporting on all of other activity.

name: NSCCL-MASS-IND
description:
NSCCL-MASS is a Website provided & hosted by NSCCL.  This application replaces the utilities - NCMS & NOTIS.   There are 3 main functions of this application :
1)  Margins :  Stock exchange members can view their margin utilization realtime on this website.
2)  Trade Confirmations:   Trade confirmations for  obligation giveup from Trading member to Clearing members.
3)  Clearing Trades:  Application provides realtime view of trades executed by clearing member's client with other brokers.  This info is published via API & can be used to intergrate  member's Risk Management system with the NSCCL-MASS.

TPMA Sub-type:  Market Mandated Application

name: EMIR RTS 2.0 Reporting Interim Solution
description:
EMIR RTS 2.0 is an enhancement of existing reporting requirements for derivative transactions under EMIR (European Market Infrastructure Regulation), which will come into force on 1st Nov. 2017; DB Lux is reporting client trades (ETD's and OTC/FX) directly to a trade repository (i.e. DTCC), and has delegated the reporting of the market side of the trades to DB AG, London (as counterparty of all back-to-back trades)
Since Avaloq go-live date (4/12/17 or 2/1/18 - to be decided on 30/10/17) will be after the entry into force date of EMIR RTS 2.0 (1/11/17), an End User Developed Application (EUDA) is being developed for the interim period. It will be based on A.) EMIR 2.0 delegated report from DB AG, London, B.) current IBP-based EMIR 1.0 report from DB Lux and C.) manual interventions / enhancements
